page.title: 15BIRD LIFE
page.content: Common summer visitors include House Martin and Swallows with small numbers of Swift and in Carr Wood a pair of Pied Flycatchers nested which is unusual for the area.Wrens, Robins, Magpie, Blackbirds,Song and Mistle Thrushes,Blue and Great Tits Chaffinches, Tree Creepers and Blackcaps are also present. Goldfinches, Bullfinches and Pied Wagtails have been seen in hedgerows around Hepworth and we have seen signs of Woodpecker activities. On the moorland there are Curlew and Lapwing with numbers of Wheatear (sq1905) and Linnets. Herons fly over the area and large Starling flocks were seen. Between Scholes and Jackson Bridge is a rookery with up to 15 nests in some trees. Tawny owls nested in square1806 and Barn owls are seen occasionally. Kestrels hunt throughout the area.
